oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Jo Walker-Meador Interviewed by Uncle Len Ellis in 1971
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Uncle Len Ellis (WLJE) interviewing Jo Walker. The recording takes place in 1971.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jo Walker-Meador;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:00) -- Introduction of Jo Walker-Meador by Uncle Len Ellis - Executive Director of The Country Music Association. Uncle Len Ellis also introduces Roy Horton. (0:55) -- Uncle Len Ellis describes how he personally joined the CMA. (1:45) -- Jo Walker mentions that Uncle Len Ellis was on the board at CMA and served as director for the CMA. (1:58) -- Jo Walker clarifies that the first CMA banquet was at the Brentwood Country Club and the second banquet was held at the Biltmore. The first banquets served as fundraising efforts for the organization (CMA). (2:49) -- Jo Walker describes overselling the house for the 2nd banquet at the Biltmore. (3:06) -- Uncle Len Ellis describes a story about the first board of directors at the CMA. Uncle Len Ellis tells a joke about Pee Wee King getting his photograph taken. (3:58) -- Uncle Len Ellis praises Jo Walker's career at the CMA. Jo Walker goes on to describe her business travelling for CMA. (4:58) -- Uncle Len Ellis reflects on the beginnings of the CMA. (5:26) -- Uncle Len Ellis asks Jo Walker about the highlight of her career with CMA. Jo Walker mentions that the opening of the Country Music Hall Of Fame And Museum was the biggest highlight of her career. (6:38) -- Uncle Len Ellis asks Jo Walker about Roy Horton. (7:40) -- Uncle Len Ellis' interview outro.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Walker-Meador, Jo;
